We are sorry you found us too expensive to use for your case.  As discussed in all consultations, there are many factors in determining the amount of money required for the retainer.  In some cases our retainer is increased due to the number of attorneys in the case before we are hired and sometimes the retainer is increased based on the complexity of the issues involved.  We wish you the best in your search for an attorney and as always wish all of our potential clients the best of luck with their case. We are sorry you found us too expensive to use for your case.  As discussed in all consultations, there are many factors in determining the amount of money required for the retainer.  In some cases our retainer is increased due to the number of attorneys in the case before we are hired and sometimes the retainer is increased based on the complexity of the issues involved.  We wish you the best in your search for an attorney and as always wish all of our potential clients the best of luck with their case. These are topics I learned the hard way and discovered not every lawyer who professes to be a military divorce expert is familiar with (for the record I can immediately name 3 locally). I did a lot of research during and after my divorce and can tell you that Michell has a firm grasp of the intricacies of military divorces (and he's even written a book further demonstrating his understanding). resp.text:
Dear Mr. Knowles,

I regret that you are unhappy with the outcome of your case, which was concluded when you indicated to the judge in open court that you understood and approved the agreement with your ex-wife for the entry of a judgment against your ex-wife, for which judgment your ex-wife has been paying since.  My records show that the judgment was entered and sent to you in January of 2017, some seven months prior to your review.  You have been notified immediately upon receipt of all payments made against the judgment, and you directed my office to hold those payments for you while you were in the process of moving.   Since that time, you have picked up all of the payments that your ex-wife has sent to this office.  Your ex-wife has your new address to send further payments directly to you.  I understand that you have also sought to garnish your ex-wife, and my paralegal communicated to you the cost of a consultation for further proceedings, which you declined to pay.  My paralegal did then  direct you to the appropriate clerk's office at the courthouse so that you could initiate further collection proceedings on your own if you chose to do so, even though your ex-wife has been making payments against the judgment.  I certainly appeared at the trial setting at which we obtained the judgment  against your ex-wife.  If you had wanted me to appear at any subsequent proceedings, you would have had to arrange for my further representation, which you did not.

name: Josh Kemp
text: I used Mr. Campbell for my divorce/child custody case. It was an uncontested divorce except for the fact that my ex wanted child support. Well, I didn't know any better, and I knew she wouldn't sign the papers if there was no child support so I agreed to give her what Mr. Campbell had come up with: $400. My ex originally wanted something like $650 per month so I looked at that as a win. Well, after talking with different people who have joint legal and physical custody like I do, they wonder why in the hell am I paying my ex ANY child support, since I have her week on and week off. And, after talking with two different lawyers, they wonder the same thing. The lawyer I have now told me if I'd taken our case to court, the judge would NOT have awarded child support to my ex. We will be going back to court needless to say, will definitely not be using Mr. Campbell who screwed me over.

resp.text: Dear Mr. Kemp, I appreciate the opportunity to have assisted with your case, but I do wish you had taken an opportunity to follow up with me about these concerns.  I did leave a message for you to call me concerning this matter, but I have not heard back from you.  I can address your concerns here.  As you might recall, you came to me to fix the agreement that you had tried to file on your own and that the court had rejected.  Without going into the details of the numbers involved with your case (which details are a matter of record) I can confidently say that you would likely have been ordered to pay around $400 per month in child support if you were awarded true joint physical custody after a trial.  If you had tried your case and been awarded joint legal custody, with your wife being awarded sole physical custody, you would have likely been ordered to pay around $650 per month.  Note that there is a difference between joint physical, versus joint legal, custody.  In Alabama, child support must still be calculated, and the judge still must state whether or not Rule 32 has been followed, even in joint physical custody situations.  This means that one party who makes significantly more than the other may still have to pay an amount of child support, and the method used to calculate $400 per month in your case is one that is accepted by the courts.  If two people make the same income, or have an agreement to deviate from guidelines, it is possible to have an order without child support.  Those conditions were not present in your situation.  The alternative would have been to pay me (or another lawyer) much more money to take your case to trial, and make an argument for custody and support, the result of which would not have been a certainty (and could result in less favorable terms of custody and having to pay more support than your agreement).  I'll be glad to explain this to the other persons that have provided feedback to you, as I fear that they must be either misinformed as to the facts or the law.  I am glad to have had the opportunity to assist you, and I will be happy to follow up with you concerning any questions that you have about this matter.

text:
Run away.   For a traffic ticket they wanted $250 to sign you up for defensive driving.   Call the court.  They will do it for free.   They prey on people that want to clear their driving records.  So sorry people have to deal with this.  Alabama bar association should have hundreds of complaints against these people.

At least they will have one after today!!!   Along with the states attorney general.

Mr Kreps.   Thank you for your response.  And yes. We have both been able to generate public records at this along.  I won’t go to low and degrading levels implying that you have mental issues as you have done so.  I can see how your law firm works first and and responds to complaints by trying to belittle them on a public forum.  Is t it nice to be able to take pics of your responses off records before you edit them.

resp.text: We love all of our potential and current clients.  Everyone has the right to post something negative online so this is a safe space for you to vent.  I’ve been doing this for almost 20 years and have seen most everything and dealt with all different types of people.  We tried to reach out to you three times by telephone to figure out what it is that you were upset about but you refuse to answer the phone and actually talk to us.  I guess you are busy working on your complaint to the attorney general’s office and the Alabama State Bar (both of which we welcome you to file by the way - that is your right).  So, let me get this straight - you were visiting Alabama from Texas and you received a speeding ticket. You waited about a month and contacted our law firm to ask for help in handling the ticket.  We responded immediately, gave you the care and concern that you were seeking, went over the process with you and your options.  We quoted you a very reasonable fee and told you what we could do in order to resolve the case.  You told us that was too much and you were going to pay the ticket and move on - obviously that would not be based on our suggestion because we ALWAYS try to avoid a conviction for our clients (and we are a traffic ticket defense law firm... that you contacted for help).  Presumably, before you paid the ticket, you attempted to communicate on your own to try and get the ticket resolved (which every defendant out there has the right to do - only most people would do that first before contacting us but I guess that didn’t occur to you).  You then called us back and were upset because you resolved the ticket on your own…allegedly - after checking, it is clear that no resolution has been entered into the state system.  We love you man - but whatever it is that is troubling you has nothing to do with us - we hope you get whatever it is straightened out.  As for the frivolous complaints you have tried to threaten us with to the Alabama Attorney General’s office and the Alabama State Bar - bring it on.  We fight like hell for ourselves just like we fight like hell for our clients.  And another thing you may want to keep in mind - the goal of resolving a traffic ticket is so that you have no conviction and presumably no public record of it.  But, you sir, have done a great job of creating a public record of it for whatever reason and for the entire world to see.  Best of luck to you.  Joseph C. Kreps

name: Scott Zbaren
text: Kreps was able to get my speeding citation dismissed.  Process was pretty simple. They send you a checklist of what to do prior to the court date, they represent you in court, pay the court costs, and that’s it.  Communication was limited and only conducted when needed.  Cost me more than just paying the citation, but saved me from having points in my license.

name: Butch Pinkston
text:
Complete and utter waste of money.  After spending $500 with these hacks, I’m in a WORSE position than when I started.

The entire operation is run by a para-legal through text messages.  They promise everything but deliver nothing.  Total cookie-cutter law, no interest in actually defending a case.  I expect this kind of lying, duplicitous bull-sh*t from the cops and the government but not the people you pay good money to represent you.

resp.text:
* Thank you so much for your comments about my law firm - we certainly appreciate your comments and your feedback. We always love and enjoy any type of feedback. We ❤️public criticism of our firm because it allows others to see how we handle our business and how we respond and most of all, it causes us to step back and fully analyze a problem or situation to see what happened, where we can improve and it gives us a valuable opportunity to reach out to a client who is clearly hurting and offer support in whatever way we can.
The only issue in reaching out to you is that we do not know who you are and this is the first we have heard of any problem such as the one you describe - unfortunately, we do not currently have and have never had a client by the name of Butch Pinkston.  If I personally have an issue with a business, I usually contact the business directly and try to resolve whatever it is that is going on.  Businesses don’t get to make things up or hide behind fake names on the internet - I am as transparent as it gets and all of my actual clients know this.
*I have been practicing law for 16+ years and have successfully resolved 17,000+ charges for clients over that period of time.  I am a man - through and through - if someone has a problem with me, all they have to do is explain what the issue is and if I have made a mistake, then I am glad to admit the mistake, apologize and fix it.  That is the measure of a man.
Anyone that knows me and that I have helped knows that I am not a hack, a liar or deceitful - far from it.  If only a successful law practice could be run with a paralegal through text messages - but as you would know if we actually represented you, when someone hires us they are able to text us (and our clients LOVE this option), email us, they get a link to schedule an appointment (at a time convenient for the client) to talk with my staff, they also get a link to schedule an appointment (at a time convenient for the client) with an attorney and also, get our direct dial so all they have to do is call us with a question or issue or to schedule a call with anyone that works for me or an attorney (myself included).
* You don’t get to the level we are and have the impeccable reputation across Alabama and the country that I have by “promising everything but delivering nothing.”  Close to 100% of our charges we handle are ultimately dismissed - if that is “cookie-cutter law” then so be it.  Apparently, our clients love having their charges dismissed.  We have the utmost interest in defending cases - our actual clients know this.  Every single time we speak to a potential client or go over case resolutions with our clients, our goal is to develop options with the ultimate goal of having the charge(s) dismissed.  Once we have options on the table, we go over those options and our clients get to decide how to proceed - we don’t force anyone to accept any offer on the table and are always available to continue fighting, take the case to the next level or have a trial.  It is our client’s case and they get to decide.
* Wow - in your review you said, “I expect this kind of lying, duplicitous BS from the cops and the government but not the people you pay good money to represent you.”  Really?  You expect the cops and the government to lie?  What a sad, sad worldview you have - which explains the many false statements you made while hiding behind a fake name.  I practice law to relieve human suffering - period.  No other reason.  I love people - even the people that choose to post random diatribes attacking me on the internet.
*I invite anyone reading this or looking for a lawyer to Google my name (Joseph Kreps) and review the info about me and my law firm and all of the great work that we do throughout the State of Alabama for clients located all over the world.  I stand by my work and the work of everyone who is on my team.   Joseph C. Kreps * Alabama Lawyer * Lover of People * Defender of Human Beings

name: A Google User
text:
Where do I begin? I was arrested for DUI, Open Container, and speeding. I spent 10  hours in jail thinking my life would never be the same again once these charges  permanently stained my record. At first, I figured there was no point in hiring a lawyer  considering the fact that I was caught dead to rights. I was caught speeding. I was  caught with open container. I blew a .11 once I got to the station. What further proof  would they need to charge me with a DUI? How could I possibly get out of that? A  month went by and I still hadn't hired a lawyer. I got to thinking about it and I figured I  would try and find a good DUI attorney to at least provide some good advice before  entering my case single handedly. I then did some research, and happened to stumble  upon Attorney Joseph C Kreps' YouTube videos online that explained what would  happen if I were actually charged with these convictions. They were so enlightening that  I couldn't help but give this guy a call to see if he could help with my case. I gave him a  call & after getting my information & case details; one of the first things his secretary  mentioned was that they may be able to get the sentence reduced to a public  intoxication. I was astounded, thinking there's no way. I was caught dead to rights. I'm  going down. No doubt about it. I then decided to pay the fee and to hire Attorney Joseph  C Kreps' as my DUI Defense Lawyer (not NEAR as high as what I was quoted from  other firms). His very helpful team then guided me through the process of completing a  series of tasks that would help my case. I completed a questionnaire and a few other
simple tasks that would, in fact, turn out to help my case tremendously. A month later, I  was scheduled to arrive in court on a Wednesday. On a Monday afternoon prior to my  court date, I received a phone call that explained to me that I wouldn't need to show up  in court on Wednesday and that there was a high possibility that my case was going to  be dismissed. I was absolutely thrilled. How could this happen? I was caught dead to  rights! Two days later I received a phone call and an email from the firm saying that if I  completed a level two CRO, 20 hours of community service, and paid a $600 fine plus  court costs, that all charges were to be dismissed! My entire future was left in the hands  of Attorney Joseph C Kreps, and I couldn't have put it in a better place. I now have no  DUI charges and no open container charges on my record. I'm telling you from  experience, this man and his firm are the absolute best DUI Defense Firm you could  possibly hire for your case. ­ If you have a DUI pending ­ Stop what you're doing ­ Call  this firm. It will be the best call you've ever made.

name: Brooke Espinosa
text: You are the reason that people don't like to deal with attorneys! The cases were not DISMISSED, they were  NOT PROCESSED.

resp.text:
Brooke:
Thank you so much for removing the false information from your original review.  We don’t want any trouble with you - you know that - but if a review is posted with false information then that is not fair and everyone would agree with that.  We certainly appreciate your comments and your feedback. We always love and enjoy any type of feedback.  We ❤️ public criticism of our firm because it allows others to see how we handle our business and how we respond and most of all, it causes us to step back and fully analyze a problem or situation to see what happened, where we can improve and it gives us a valuable opportunity to reach out to a client who is clearly hurting and offer support in whatever way we can.
We never claim to be perfect and certainly don't want anyone to think that we are perfect.  As you know, Brooke, we did not represent you.  We represented your partner who is going through the immigration process in the United States of America. We take great pride in the knowledge and the experience that we have over the last 15+ years in handling and resolving 13,000+ charges all over the State of Alabama. When I was made aware of these issues, we reached out to you to try to resolve it within hours and on the next business morning 7-18-18.  When we did reach out ASAP, you went on and on and then hung up on us before we could even talk.  We tried to call back to no avail.  I personally tried to call back to no avail.
The first and most important thing that I would like to point out is that BOTH of the actual client’s charges were DISMISSED.  And it wasn’t just a “traffic ticket”.  He had 2 charges one of which was failure to obey police/fireman.  Immigration is a difficult process and who knows how this could have seriously impacted his immigration issues - that process and system is ALWAYS CHANGING as everyone knows… but it shouldn’t impact him now because we got BOTH OF HIS CHARGES DISMISSED 😉!
As to the class that was required of him, we are sorry that his time was taken from him in order to do that - our main concern was and is his immigration status and getting the charges dismissed.  His completing a class while his lawyers worked through issues beyond anyone’s control seems like a small price to pay to continue the long and difficult process of becoming a legal United States 🇺🇸 Citizen.
It is important for anyone reading this to know that we did email you the DISMISSAL disposition of BOTH CHARGES back in March 2018... and heard not a peep out of you until this review surfaced almost 4.5 months later.  It is baffling.  We love deeply and dearly every single one of our clients and their friends and family including your partner and also you, Brooke.  We still love you no matter you might post about us.  This is the truth because our love for our clients and our love and passion for our work and the system is not dependent on how others think or feel about us because we know the truth and our love is our love no matter what - it’s just who we are.
I invite anyone reading this or looking for a lawyer to Google my name (Joseph Kreps) at any time and see all of the great information about me and my law firm and all of the great work that we do throughout the State of Alabama.  I stand by my work and the work of everyone who is on my team.  We love what we do because we love people and we love to help people - it’s why I am alive and why I was put on this earth and called to do this type of work.
Much love to you, Brooke, and your partner.  If you change your mind and desire to speak to me then I am always here and always willing to talk.  If you or any family members need our help again in the future, please let us know as we would be honored to assist and help you with anything that comes up.
Joseph C. Kreps
Alabama Lawyer * Lover of People * Defender of Human Beings

name: Jenny Frank
text:
When I came to Brett for the purpose of retaining an attorney for my case, it obviously was not a happy affair. However, throughout the entire process, Brett made my experience substantially manageable. When I did not feel very hopeful for a chance that my case would go smoothly and in my favor, Brett knew exactly what to do with his developed knowledge of the law and extensive experience in court.

Initially, Brett told me all of the viable options he felt possible and gave me the option to choose what I wanted to proceed with, keeping in mind the potential consequences and how likely he felt things to play out the way we intended and wanted. He was always very upfront, concise, and easy to understand. Brett was always empathetic with how I felt and how different outcomes might affect my personal life and education/career options. Keeping my interests in mind, Brett managed to return the best possible outcome for me while minimally invading on my personal commitments.

While it was difficult to appear in court because I live in New York City, Brett kept things simple and never made me appear personally for his own ease. He was easy to contact because I had two emails and his cell phone number. Additionally, he was always quick to reply to my concerns and questions, even after office hours or on weekends. I NEVER felt as though Brett had exclusive control and management of my options because he informed me at every update he received and really leveled with me as an individual to come up with and decide on challenges together.

Because Brett formally worked "on the other side of things" in the courtroom, he knew the ins and outs of what was to be expected from the district attorneys or judges. He knew people personally and they also seemed to think highly of him because they were always friendly in response. This experience was crucial to my case and changed the entire outcome of what I initially thought possible.

By working with me instead of "for" me, Brett took my interests and concerns to heart - he recognized how these sorts of situations are detrimental in many ways and it was obvious he cared about me succeeding in life long after my file was finalized. If I were local to the area at all, Brett would definitely be the attorney I retained consistently for any of my criminal law needs. Also, compared to other attorneys offering me "worse" potential outcomes, Brett was super affordable. He made payment quick and easy and was willing to help through consultation and the like before I had submitted payment. Although I paid all at once by credit card, he also offered payment options.

If you are in the area and need genuine help concerning a criminal record/issue, Brett is the man to talk to! He will put your mind at ease and take care of everything while leaving you in control of your own file and life.

text: Davis Varner was hired to represent a family member in court on a CRO Violation. When we spoke to Davis during the free consultation, he made you believe that the judge wouldn't sentence you to jail for a violation like that. We explained everything up front. He had all the information that was going to be brought up in court.  He acted like there was a possible of getting color code extended for few more months. He said I just don't see that judge sentencing you to jail. We had confidence in Davis that he would do a great job. I looked at the law firm website they had a section on color code violation. They acted like they had experience in handling these cases. Court day came and we didn't have a very good outcome. The worst thing possible happened. Davis didn't do anything to help his client. I wouldn't hire him again to represent anybody in a CRO Violation. You would be better off going with the court appointed attorney. Terrible experience!

name: EddyGordo21
text:
My mother has been dealing with this law firm for an abundance of years, and her experience has been far from stellar. This place moved three times since she has been their client, and they never informed her until she called them herself because they do not contact her. David, the person with whom she asks to speak, is constantly dodging her because he is always "out of the office" or "with another 'more important' client." I'm sure NONE of those "more important" clients have been as equanimous with them as she has.

David has apparently trained his staff to dodge her as well since she called them, and Alice refused to answer the phone (probably because of caller ID) but when I called, she answered the phone just to place us on hold to retrieve something so minuscule that it took less than 30 seconds to do...

Apparently this lawyer and his team care nothing about their clients--and dare I say clients of color... But this is the behavior that is typical of many businesses in the north central region of Alabama. Once the better business bureau is contacted, however, maybe they will change their tone.

If she had not contacted the actual courthouse to get her court date, she would not have even known of the impending court date. After calling these people several times, they refused to give her any of her case details.

So with regard to the other negative review this institution has received, I do NOT agree with the owner that "it is the work of a competitor." I have seen these practices first-hand, and I am far from a capital seeking adversary.

resp.text:
Because we don't recognize your name and you don't appear to be a client of our firm, based off your screen name, there's no way for us to address this issue without knowing the exact name of the client. We also do not have, nor have we ever had, any employees by the name of David or Alice. Are you sure you have the correct firm?

In relation to your comment about "people of color," approximately half of our clients are non-caucasion clients and are "people of color." We have dedicated this firm to representing clients who have been injured, oppressed, overlooked and not been treated fairly, regardless of their designation. Over the years, the lawyers and staff of our firm have also volunteered countless hours of their personal time participating in charities and outreach programs that benefit all segments of our community.

Although we're respectful of your opinion, the assertions you've made about the issue of race are reckless and inaccurate and thats clearly proven by 17 years of close relationships with people of all genders, races and socio-economic statuses that are repeat clients. Many people leaving reviews on this very site are "people of color" and would strongly disagree with your statement and actually take offense to it. Writing a negative review about a business that's never represented you is one thing but making baseless accusations of racial unfairness about people you don't know and who have spent their careers representing underprivileged segments of our state and communities is something else.

If your mother is dissatisfied with any service that any lawyer or staff member of our firm has ever provided, then please have your mother, personally, reach out immediately and ask for the head practice manager so that we can rectify this matter.

We take any client dis-satisfaction very seriously and want every client to be satisfied with our efforts. If your mother is, indeed, a past or current client, then any concerns your mother has will be given our complete attention and we will do our very best to address her concerns.

name: Melanie Daugherty
text: Josh O'Neal is the absolute worst attorney I have ever had. He refuses to return phone calls. He called me ONE TIME during my divorce, the day before the hearing. He never even bothered to send me the final divorce decree. I had no idea what my divorce papers said until his secretary emailed them to me, after the THIRD request. I know all of his secretaries because they are the only ones I could ever talk to. Half the time, they didn't return phone calls either. Halfway through the 'mediation' I got the distinct feeling that he was working for the other side. He obviously thinks he can make a living by gaining clients, screwing them over, and going on to the next victim. He must be too young and immature to grasp the concept that most people will need an attorney more than ONCE in their lifetime, and if he thinks he can be successful without the benefit of repeat clients, he is delusional. If he was the last attorney on earth, I would never hire him again. My divorce is final; I'm still missing half my belongings; he's promised me a refund twice and never delivered. On top of that, he suggested we file a contempt motion because of the fact that I was not given all the belongings I was entitled to. He didn't mention at the time that he planned on charging me an additional $1500 to do what I'd already paid him to do. In my opinion, the reason all his pictures on FB look like gangster photos is because he is a crook. He will stand there and 'listen' to you, but he is just pretending to hear you. You'd have more luck talking to a brick wall. Plus the brick wall might return your calls. I read a bad review of his, and I should have heeded it. If you need a great attorney, contact Michael Haynes.

text: Where do I start?! Kris is a GAMECHANGER for Family Law. She is organized, responsive, caring, and more importantly...she gets results! I am so grateful to have met her. She is someone that you can tell your issue to once and she knows what you are thinking and how to fix it before you do. Nobody ever wants to go to court and I was a nervous wreck even though I was the one that filed. Kris was so compassionate, told me to relax...that she's got it and she was right. She will have your back! To achieve that level of trust that quickly when dealing with your family is priceless to me. I will forever be so grateful to have met her. Kris Sexton is definitely who you need to hire for custody issues, etc. Hopefully I will not need her again...but she offered to be on stand by if I needed anything else. What a great lawyer!

In the end, he and his office were prompt and helpful with any questions or assistance needed. If you ever need any legal guidance in Alabama, be sure to reach out to Merrell Law Firm!

text: Ed Merrell and his staff's professionalism is outstanding. I would recommend this Firm above all others I have used in the past. They get the job done. You can rest assured your legal matters are in the best hands for whatever issues you are needing done. Five stars!!

name: Josh Johnson
text: I dont typically post reviews, but I understand the difficulty finding good legal representation. Hopefully this review will help others in narrowing their search for legal representation. I spent time searching for the right fit for myself when going through a divorce. I landed with Merrell law firm. I can say without a doubt, I made the right choice. My divorce was difficult at best, but Ed was always a calming force, was honest with his feedback, and fought hard for my rights. Ed is not your "typical" attorney. I was unfortunately involved with other attorneys during this process, that were not employed at Merrill law firm. I quickly learned a lesson in law. In my experience a lot of attorneys are concerned first and foremost with money, and concerned secondary with actually dealing with and helping the person behind their paycheck. I never felt this way with Ed Merrell or anyone else at Merrell law firm. Ed has a passion for actually helping his clients and a genuine/honest approach to his job. If you want honest, hard-working, knowledgeable, representation, go with Merrell.

I am going through a nasty divorce. I wanted Mr. Merrell to rep. Me but he pushed me off on Mrs. Harrison. I paid $1000 for her to come to my Pendente Lite court appearance. I had never saw her. She asked me for a document and disappeared for a while. She came and got me around the side hall on another wooden bench after back surgery. I paid another $500 to send the answer to the Decree. Never got to speak to her again. I sent emails and got a rude email saying "I can not check emails all day. You aren't my only case.
I then got a letter from Ed which was asking for $5000 immediately to cover the remainder of the case. I sent Mrs. Harrison an email that I had something that could shut down the case. I got a rude email that told me they would not speak to me or return an email till I paid $460 or so now and then the remainder of $5000. That was the last straw. I got them to send me an invoice for ONLY what was behind. I WILL NEVER SUGGEST THEM. Now with no lawyer searching for another I am going to lose my battle to keep my son. It's all about the $$$. I'm paying the deficit, getting my stuff and taking it to another attorney.

text: I hired Mr. Merrell to represent me in an emergency hearing to try and get custody of my grand child and keep her from being okaced in foster care. She told me that I could not enter the court room because I was not a party to the case but the child's mother was present and wanted me to go in with her and I had every right to do that but Ms.Baulder refused and just sat at the table and did nothing. She told me that a half day at court would cost $650.00. I contacted Mr. Merrill and asked for my money back he would not even refund me the $350.00 that was left after paying her the $650.00 for doing nothing. I had paid him $1030.00 and he sent me a check for $15.00. Do not trust this law firm.,

name: Linda Ponziano
text: I first met April Bauder at legal aid in Birmingham. I took my daughter with me to be my other "eyes and ears" as I suffer from anxiety and panic disorders, and needed legal advice as my husband was divorcing me, for the 4th time and I had no money to hire an attorney. April was kind and compassionate and patient. I started off my divorce without a lawyer, as the husband made me all kind of promises, and I believed him. You know the saying " fool me once, shame on you, fool me 7639 times.....", well..... things got ugly, and I saved my quarters, dimes, and nickles, worked harder, and on Jan 23, 2018 I hired Miss April Bauder. Why? You don't  fake kindness, that is something  you are taught. You don't fake compassion, that is something you feel. People with handicaps are treated "different", and April has never treated me different. She ALWAYS returns my calls, and last, her laughter! She has this infectious,  contagious  BEAUTIFUL laughter!!!!  The last few months have been sorrowful, painful, and soooo much hurt. I could cry til the sun goes down, April calls me and I giggle, and giggle and giggle! Proverbs 17:22 "a cheerful heart is good medicine, but a crushed spirit dries up the bones." (NIV)  AND Leah Thomas? Well, somewhere is a storage unit, there is a sparkling little tiara, for her, and she will be the guest of honor at my next pool party! Thank you, thank you thank you, April. If it wasn't for your volunteer work, I would of never found you. Grateful  for the Merrell Law Firm, and what it produces out of it's  people, for people like me who are struggling.... Linda Lee Ponziano Bradford

text:

They called back in a timely manner, lowered the fee of one bc we were a “package deal” in which I very appreciate HOWEVER he changed my “defendents statement” after we had already signed. Including information that was false and incorrect. He was a solid 30 minutes late for court. So after having falsified court documents, I called him to get them changed or corrected and his response was that the DA needed what the paraphernalia was so “maybe he should have ran it by us”, it didn’t matter, he couldn’t do anything, and the judge already signed off on it. Then upon exiting the court offered to walk us out just to ask for a review on Google. He was pretty easy to talk to, which was the only thing I had to really say until I saw my falsified documents.

‼️UPDATE‼️: MISUNDERSTANDING WAS CORRECTED AND BRIAN MADE SURE THE DOCUMENTS WERE CORRECTED ON BOTH ENDS AND CONTACTED ME IMMEDIATELY WITH FILED/APPROVED CORRECTIONS. I highly recommend using his services! ‼️UPDATE‼️

resp.text: Thank you Hanna. I assure you I had no intent to falsify anything. It was an honest mistake and I’m happy I could help get everything straightened out for you. Best wishes!

name: katelyn Turner
text: Just a whole mess. Any works for you before the judge never answer calls, reply via email, send paperwork in. Speak for you

resp.text: I’m not sure what you mean Katelyn. We worked hard for you and received a Very good plea agreement on your behalf.

text: Great job very attentive to my case and genuinely worked hard! Thanks Brian and your staff!!

resp.text: Glad we could help Jeffrey

name: Frank Page
text: In 2012 Mr Dasinger was court appointed to me in a criminal case, I never once met with him,spoke to him, nothing until my court date. I wrote many letters, and my family made many calls to no response. The day of court, he had no idea who I was or anything about my case. All he had to say was the state is sending you to prison and to accept it cause that was my only option. I was young, scared, and had no idea what to do. He on the other hand, played on fb, laughed it up with the states attorney, and my victim. My first and only felony, poss of forged instrument, two checks for less than $50, got me 3 yrs. I got more help from the inmates sitting next to me that day than I got from him. He did NOTHING in my deffense. I do honestly believe the outcome would have been less severe if I had paid him cash, or if I had went with a diffrent lawyer. It has been many years and I do hope he has grown as a lawyer and person since then, but I would not recommend him.

resp.text: Unfortunately, when I held a contract with the State of Alabama as an appointed attorney, I did not have the time to meet with all of the 100+ new clients that I was appointed to represent each month. The numbers were simply overwhelming and impossible to keep up with.  I have not handled court appointed work since 2013 because I wanted to be able to give more personal attention to all of my clients, which I am now able to do.  I'm deeply sorry that I couldn't have helped you more Frank.  I hope all is going well and I wish you a prosperous 2019.

It was as long road, but i know have a successful business of my own and, am and was  , able to raise 3 beautiful young ladies whom im very proud of. If it wasnt for brian dasinger i would not be able to sit here and write these words today, so if you have any questions or doubts about this mans integrity , beliefs or rather or not he will fight till the end for you, please do not hesitate to ask me or my family. Hes a good man and i would have him in my corner without question. Thanks  for your time and god bless.

name: Antonio Richardson
text: Do not use Steven Eversole out of Birmingham Alabama as an attorney.  I'm warning you he will get your money. My mother lost almost $4,000 from him; in which he promised us some good news for a rule 32 appeal in which he wrote to the States of Alabama  for my brother to get a lesser sentence on his case.

resp.text:
Mr. Richardson, Rule 32's are inherently difficult as you and your family are well aware and were well advised.  They are last ditch efforts after a criminal defendant has been convicted and their appeals denied.  Statistically they have some of the lowest possibility of success in the criminal justice system.  The only thing Eversole Law ever promises anyone is that we will do everything we can to help our clients in any way we can.  And Mr. Richardson, Steven Eversole did not represent your brother, but another attorney in the firm.   You should know that.  Either way,  Mr. Eversole has has great success filing Rule 32 and other post-conviction relief measures for clients, but nothing is ever guaranteed. In 2014 Mr. Eversole himself overturned 287 life sentences and over 2000 years sentence in one case.  In 2013 he overturned a sex crime conviction with life time registration  with an out-of-time Rule 32 Petition in a 26 year old case.  In 2015 Mr. Eversole overturned a several year old drug conviction with another out-of-time Rule 32 Petition.  And again in 2016 Mr. Eversole overturned a 2010, 20 year sentence on a drug trafficking conviction that released our client 15 years earlier on a post conviction relief measure.  And these are just a small accounting of his success. He has won appeals in both criminal and civil matters and been highly successful in both trial and appellate matters in hundreds if not thousands of cases.

Here is just a sampling of Mr. Eversole and the his firm's success: Admitted to practice in All State and Federal Courts in Alabama: •All Alabama State Courts, •Alabama Supreme Court, •Alabama Court of Appeals, •Northern & Middle District of Alabama. Qualifications •Focuses on Criminal Defense and Divorce •Handled thousands of cases •2013, 2014, 2015, 2016 National Top 100 Trial Lawyer •Birmingham Magazine's Top Criminal Lawyer and Top Divorce Lawyer in the same year, 2014 •B-Metro Magazine's Top Lawyer 2016 •B-Metro Magazine's Rising Star 2014 •Newsweek Magazine's Top 14 Criminal Defense Lawyers 2014 •Top 10 Under 40 by the National Academy of Criminal Defense Lawyers •B-Metro Magazine's Face's of Birmingham •AVVO Rate 10/10 •AVVO Top Criminal Lawyer 2015 •AVVO Client Choice Award Winner •Publishes Criminal Defense Blog since 2008 Top Criminal Defense Blog award •Better Business Bureau A+ Rating •Frequent presenter on legal matters •Published several books. Professional & Bar Association Memberships •National Association of Criminal Defense Lawyers •Alabama Association of Criminal Defense Lawyer •National Trial Lawyer's Criminal Trial Lawyer's Association •Birmingham Association •National Organization for Reform of Marijuana Laws(NORML) Legal Committee •National College of DUI Defense •Alabama State Bar •Birmingham Bar Association •Shelby County Bar Association

We are sorry your brother's case didn't work out.  But you don't shoot the messenger when the message is bad.  We wish you and your family all the best in future.  God Bless.

resp.text: I am sorry you unsatisfied.  It is hard to reply when we do not know who you or have any knowledge of these allegations you make.  I can assure you no one at this firm has missed a court date and we are well aware of all court proceedings.  Every case is calendared immediately upon intake in our Case Management System.  It notifies the entire office of all court dates, times, and place.  We can even remotely access this information from anywhere in the world if necessary.  Now meetings may get rescheduled very rarely, but that's just the nature of the beast.  Court hearings and trials often run long and we often have little control of the time a hearing may take for various reasons., thus requiring someone to reschedule a meeting now and then,  but we are always prepared for court.  Mr. Eversole's resume speaks for itself.  He was just recently named in B-Metro's Top Attorney Magazine for 2017 and has represented thousands of clients with great success.  Again,  if you are in fact a client, please call the office and we'd be happy to address any concerns.

resp.text: Mr. Moses, I applaud you for actually being real and using your own name.  Admirable. All the calls and communication is recorded.  Otherwise, how did you manage to come to court each time and get that case dismissed? resp.text: Ms Hanke, was not the client. Her adult son was a client. She has made false allegations. It is important to know that when one who is not a client, posts on a review, it is not based on the complete occurrences of the representation as she was not the client and was not privy to all the information. In addition, when she did not get all the information she wanted about the case--attorney client privilege exists to protect the client--she asserted defamatory statements in a public forum. When the client is noncompliant, or is unwilling to pursue certain avenues of a case, the mother of an adult child becomes irritated by outcomes rather than considering the reason for the outcomes. Perhaps one should remember who the client is and that Mom's and Dad's can't make adult children act in a manner for which they want despite the desire to pay for representation. Paying for representation does not guarantee results and does not grant the person paying free access to the information in a case.

resp.text:
Eric K. Roberts was awarded the Client Champion's award in 2017, 2018, and 2019. The Client Champion award recognizes attorneys who "excel at service" to clients. Furthermore, Eric K. Roberts was awarded America's Most Honored Professionals Award in 2018 and 2019.  Eric K. Roberts has been selected as a member of the National Trial Lawyer's Top 100 Attorneys during 2017, 2018, and 2019. Since 2016, Eric K. Roberts has been selected as a member of the National Black Trial Lawyer's Top 100 Attorney in the United States of America.  Locally, Eric K. Roberts has received the Black Owned Business Award (Best Lawyer) in 2017 and 2018. These are a few of the awards that Eric K. Roberts has received while practicing law.
While in law school, Eric K. Roberts started a Civil Rights Organization while at the University of Alabama School of Law. The University of Alabama School of Law is ranked within the top 25 law schools in the nation by US News.  He also received the Order of the Samaritan for his charity work within the community.  Furthermore, while in law school, Eric K. Roberts received the Dean's Community Service Award.
Eric K. Roberts has possessed a Doctor of Theology degree from a Seminary for more than a decade.
Due to the ethical natures surrounding this individual, I have been instructed not to provide the actual issues or facts surrounding this matter.  I can clearly provide that this review does not accurately reflect the interactions pertaining to this individual.
This office has an open-door policy. The vast majority of Eric K. Roberts' clients are provided with his personal e-mail address and personal cell phone number. Eric K. Roberts receives and communicates with many clients via text message.
Once again, due to ethical restraints, I am unable to provide the public with the nature of this post.  However, Eric K. Roberts would like to take this opportunity to thank all of his former clients, which includes, Asians, African-Americans, Caucasians, and other ethnicities, who have supported his minority-owned business for almost two decades.

name: Lori Norris
text:
Hi, I’m Lori Norris. My brother, Jeremy Jerry  was charged with capitol murder charges. Dani V. Bone and Sam Bone Attorneys took his case. They are father and son.
Right from the start they were friendly and professional. They got my brother to be evaluated at Taylor Hardin Secured Medical Center. That is a much nicer place with someone with a mental illness. You got to visit for 2 hrs on the weekends in person. He was going to stay there til his trial. He had several competency hearings. He wasn’t competent. His trial was set for May. We were all grieving and sad. I love my brother no matter what. Then in April I got a call his trial was canceled. He failed his last competency test. I was happy. My brother Jeremy Jerry was going to live in a group home for the rest of his life. With competency hearings every 6 months. He could live somewhat of a life.♥️🙏

If you didn’t read anything else. Dani V. and Sam Bone are great, kind and friendly attorneys. They are professional and work hard to get the job done. They are kind and friendly but they also kick butt! I never thought this would be possible! I am grateful for them the rest of my life. Thank you Dani V. Bone and Sam Bone. I will come to you if I need an attorney in the future for sure.

Lori Norris

name: Kathy Johnson
text: Divorce is HARD no matter if you want it or not, I don't wish it on anyone. When I was faced with mine in 2019, I was referred to Dani Bone through a coworker and friend that I trusted. I initially hired Dani because I heard he was the very best and he would fight for me. I called and even though they were extremely busy, they saw me right away. After hearing my situation, Dani was honest with me and said, "You need Sam. " My case was very complicated having both personal and business issues, assets and properties to divide, custody and other court issues . Sam took it as a challenge. He stayed with me and guided me through the whole divorce process. It was not easy, it was extremely tough but Sam knew how to handle every situation that came up. When going through a 2 yr battle, you need to know and  feel confident that your attorney has your back and has your best interest at heart. I emotionally fell apart many times and he helped me to learn to stand up for myself and it made me a stronger person through this process. All I wanted was what was fair- he got me exactly what I asked for! I was extremly pleased with services of Sam, Dani and their dedicated and caring staff. Amanda, Fredrick and Osha were just wonderful to work with. The whole staff made me feel comfortable and at ease through a very uncomfortable life circumstance.  While the other party had 5 attorneys through the process , I had one.  I only needed the one team- I had The Best with Sam & Dani Bone. Sam was honest, upfront, bold and encouraging. He never had to be ugly or raise his voice in court or trial and never once belittled anyone. I recall him saying, "It doesn't have to be ugly". Being a Christian, a professional, a self employed woman, a Realtor and a mother of 2, this was imperative to me. Sam treated both parties with total RESPECT always . That was very important to me.  I did my part and provided the true facts, evidence and proof- he did his part and presented my case with true professionalism , Integrity and no one was disrespected in the process. I would 💯 percent recommend Sam & Dani Bone if you want to be represented by someone who will always have your back and is not afraid to fight for your best interest. Thank you Sam, Dani, and your amazing team. If I ever need attorney services in the future , I will use you again and will highly recommend you to anyone that I know. You Rock!

name: Bernadette Wineman
text:
Earlier this year, I found myself in need of a divorce attorney when my ex petitioned to modify our final judgment. I no longer lived in Alabama and was unsure of where to turn for legal advice. After consulting with Mr. Sam Bone, it was clear that he had a deep understanding of law and how it applied to my particular situation.

Many attorneys will promise the moon, without being able to deliver a star. Sam will be honest about your case, talk with you about the possibilities, and develop a plan to protect your best interests. Phone calls/emails are answered promptly and you are made aware of appointments and court actions. Even though my case was regular family law issues, it was treated as a priority.

When emotions run high and people play dirty, you need an attorney that will keep you focused. It was nothing short of a blessing to have Sam’s counsel during this time. Sam will listen and use what will benefit your case most, helping you to make the best decisions.

Through my experience, I learned that Sam is wise beyond his years and holds a unique combination of qualities that make him an excellent attorney. He is a younger lawyer in comparison to many of the veterans in the area, but his expertise speaks through shrewd discernment, both in and outside the courtroom.

In retrospect, I know that employing a professional, well-versed attorney who gave honest legal advice was a valuable asset to me. My case only involved family law, but I would recommend Sam Bone in every area that he practices. My children and I are thankful for the Bone Law Firm.

I was in bad shape recovering from cancer and kidney failure when I was arrested.  They made me feel like I had nothing to worry about. He will go out of his way to help and set up a payment arrangement for you.  I could not have had a better Gadsden criminal lawyer.  Sam knows the laws.  Everytime I see him he tells me he is proud for me to see how well I am doing.  I am going for my degree in psychology and further to a doctrine. name: woolrose
text:
I am 70 years old and have never, until recently, sought the assistance of an attorney (except for developing a will or to review contracts before I signed) . I asked a relative, who used to work with the court system, to suggest a good law firm. My relative stated if I wanted an Honest and Reliable firm, I should contact Barfoot and Schoettker.

After making an appointment, I met with their associate, Jase Sayre and provided him with the paperwork. We discussed my case and Jase  explained all aspects of the procedure in detail. While working my case he kept me informed of the progress. He fully explained the options available to us and allowed me to chose which avenue I though best.
The result was he recovered a very significant amount (the full amount) of money owed to me.

I highly recommend the Barfoot and Schoettker Law firm. My case was solved in a quick and extremely efficient manner. The costs were very reasonable (no padding the books or intentional delays as I have heard that some law firms do). The interaction was always professional while also being personable and productive. Thank you Jase for your hard work and honest work ethic.

name: David Peel
text: Very pleased with the legal service provided by Ben Schoettker,. His genuine care and concern for his clients is a much-appreciated bonus. Would definitely recommend this firm.

name: Joan Beasley
text:
I highly recommend Barfoot & Schottker over all others.

With only a few months left before the two year deadline of my case, I contacted this firm to consider my case. (The attorney I initially hired had unexpectedly retired.)  Barfoot & Schoettker agreed to take my case even though they were working against a close deadline.

I was impressed with their care and compassion, close straight forward communication, integrity, diligence and professionalism. Jase and Kay  were diligent in keeping me informed about the case and including me in decisions that had to be made.

Overall it was a vey positive experience, and I would not hesitate to use them again.

name: Vicki Ricke
text: Jim has been my attorney since 2015 and has been a huge asset to not only my family but to our business as well. I cannot say enough about him and his abilities. He was referred to me by another attorney which in itself speaks volumes. Pino & Associates will be our law firm for all our business and personal needs!

name: Tara Davenport
text:
In December 2015 Jim Pino was referred to me by a family friend, also an attorney and who’s advice and opinion matter greatly to me.

I needed an attorney who would fight for me. To help and advise me with a divorce after 23 years of marriage. I knew going into it that it wasn’t going to be anywhere close to pretty, much less easy for a multitude of reasons. But I also knew that I had “hit my wall” and it was necessary. I also knew that I was going to have to have an attorney that would work with me, not just for me. I had been married since I was 21.... nothing about anything was easy and I was terrified about everything.

And that’s exactly what Jim did for me.

Jim and his amazing staff helped me through one of the hardest times of my life and helped me find myself again.

I would and do, recommend Jim Pino & Associates to any and everyone who asks.

Thank you Jim and thank you to your awesome staff!!

name: Gordon Madden
text: There is not enough space to share my experience with Jim and the entire staff. They have worked with me for over a decade (11) years. Almost daily, many nights, weekends even when they've been on vacation. Never once failing to jump up to the emergency, or simply to make sure my son was protected. Because of Jim and his family, staff and associates, I have been given the opportunity to have a wonderful relationship with my little boy. He's stood in my defense against 17 different lawyers, sometimes 5 against 1. His son has stood with me as well. We've had multiple trials, most recently he postponed major surgery and suffered through a 4 day trial. Agonizing in Pain against 4 very reputable lawyers. Not to mention, he did this for 1/5 of the money the other guys were being paid. He did it because he cares and felt that it was in my son's best interest and we'll being. Just today, our order was issued. Once again, his hard work and character and one of a kind skill prevailed. I still have sole custody and I am assured a meaningful relationship with the most important thing in my life. I can never repay Jim for his decade long dedication to making sure we're protected. If you need help, a brief visit with him will reveal the true character and heart he puts into making sure justice prevails. My name is Gordon Madden and I would be happy to share my story with you.

name: Jeremy Naish
text: Mr. Pino went above and beyond to help me. He explained everything very thoroughly and let me know what to expect. He was honest and gave me options. I have used Mr. Pino on a few occasions with success every time. I highly recommend using Mr.Pino.

text: As an Intern at Reid Law Firm I get to witness everything that goes on at the firm. Chris Reid goes above and beyond not only for his clients but for his interns as well. His passion and care for helping others is second to none. He is always teaching us interns things and shows us how he implements them on cases and life experiences. Recently, at the firm we have been working a case for a local veteran battling Cystic Fibrosis, who’s father just died and was falsely declared dead by social security. So not only was this client dealing with battling for his life, he has been mentally drained from this mistake that was made by Social Security and the recent death of his father. In roughly a week with Reid Law Firm working on the case we have been able to get a senator Doug Jones, congressman Gary Palmer, and the white house involved to help expedite this case so he can get his health insurance and accounts unfroze. This has been an incredible experience working on a case getting to make such a huge difference in someone’s life.

I would describe him as incompetent, but it actually seemed worse than incompetence: he didn't believe me and he was deferring to the prosecutor's (his opponent) side. Though there clearly was some incompetence at play. Mr. Sogol told me that if I got into a pre-trial diversion program that my record would be expunged after completing it. However, I looked it up and the alleged offense for which I was arrested CANNOT be expunged under Alabama law, though I plan to litigate that issue when the time is right. If you want an attorney who will make a serious effort to learn about the intricacies of your case, I highly advise you to look elsewhere.

Its been 5 years going on 6, dealing with a particular situation that I needed advice on.
He didn't give me any legal advice because it "would have to be a case", I understood that. I don't want to waste my time or anybody else time. He was rude, he kept cutting me off with "what's your question?" Well, I dont know thats why im calling someone like you with your expertise! I am not looking to sue unless I have a case which is why I called. There are other lawyers who would give you advice without suing outside of legal aid.
However, he did refer me to legal aid, after the fact I suggested legal aid because it's FREE to receive legal advice. That was by far the best advice he could give me being that Legal aid has helped and guided me through cases before which led me to winning cases on my own, or cases being dropped. If you do not receive the advice you need with any law group(s) I would suggest Legal Aid. Legal Aid response is much quicker. Also, legal aid will listen. They will make sure they are guiding you in the right direction. Depending who you talk to, they're blunt too but they WILL help you!

text: I would give no stars if I could as I have made three calls over the course of two weeks seeking representation without a response. The answering service used is either not recording messages or the attorneys are being selective. I realize my matter is a small one; however, a return phone call within a reasonable amount of time is the bare minimum expectation this firm could not meet. I have worked in a prominent law firm for nearly a decade and know the value of customer service with every client, both large matters and small. I unfortunately cannot use that law firm as I moved a great distance away. Parkman and White, please return your phone calls, whether you can take the case or not. No firm is too big or an attorney too important to make a courtesy return call or email, at a minimum. You can even have your staff perform the task for you. This way a potential client cannot waste additional time and effort and can call someone else who cares enough to provide the service.

text: She was very reassuring during a so-called free consultation, that I hired her immediately. Everything she said during the consultation ended up to be false. When we were only a couple days away from the next court date she claimed "My niece has been in a terrible accident and hanging on to life by threads.  I will be back in touch with you before end of week." That was the kinda responses I got for every email I sent. She never got back to me or had time for my case. After several phone calls to her office, where you cannot get a live person to answer. I finally got a phone call back which I did record. I asked for an itemized statement which she claimed she doesn't give those. I asked it I could speak with the legal assistant working on my case she claimed she doesn't have those. I asked how much I had left in my retainer so I would have proof, since I didn't trust her at all at this point. She wouldn't give me a number but claimed I had plenty left that she doesn't charge much for anything. After I fired her she sent an itemized statement claiming I only had a couple hundred left and it would be mailed to me. I have filed a BBB complaint and a dispute with credit card company. I have not received anything from her and this was months ago. Do not hire this lawyer. This has got to be fraud. $3500 for a notice of appearance.

name: Kaitlyn Head
text: I couldn’t be more pleased with Warren Freeman and his amazing assistant, Valerie. I had multiple felony drug charges that had been hanging over my head for nearly 4 years. Since those charges were brought against me, I had turned my life around and became the person that I was intended to be. Warren saw that. He listened to my story, he cared and he made sure he did everything in his power to get the outcome I truly deserved. In Warren’s words I was “a true success story” and he wasn’t going to let that go without being heard. He went over and beyond by meeting with the District Attorney multiple times to discuss my case. Even after negotiating a plea deal that I never dreamed possible, he still went back AGAIN and laid my story out – showing how I had turned my life around – and getting me an even better deal than before. Warren cared. He believed in me and my story. I will be forever grateful for the time and commitment he gave to my case.

name: Billy L Billings Jr
text:
My dad passed away intestate and has a house in Alabama. I live in Orlando, FL and was trying to find an attorney in Alabama to assist me with his affairs there. So, I found Attorney Pierce online and reached out to him. His staff was very nice and very pleasant on the phone.

During my phone consultation with Attorney Pierce, he was equally as nice and very personable. He asked me some questions about the circumstances and was very attentive.

Finally, what really impressed me about him was that once he realized that my dad's house was not close to where he typically practices; he advised me that I would most likely be better served to consult an attorney that was closer to my dad's house. He said that he could handle the case; however, it would become more expensive because that area is approximately 4 hours from him. In my opinion, most people wouldn't even care about that. They would only care about running the bill up on you. In addition to that, he even found and referred me to an attorney in that area that could assist me.

I certainly appreciate his honesty and his assistance. I wish that I could've had that opportunity to work with him in my time of need. Take care, Attorney Pierce, and thank you very much. It was truly a pleasure.

resp.text: Thank you so much! I really appreciate the kind words. Our goal is always to try to help folks the best we can, even if that means sending them to friends who may be a better fit for the case based on the facts or location. I hope things are always well for you in Orlando. -KDP

text:
Kyle was a horrible lawyer. It took weeks for him to get back to us at times. We asked 4 times for emergency custody to be filed, he filed twice. It took 14 months just to get visitation set up because his priorities are all over the place. We had to do most of the information work for him. $3K, and all we have to show for it is minimal visitation. We haven't even received our receipts for the work done, and it's been 9 months. I wouldn't recommend him to anyone.
If I could give 0 stars, I would.

resp.text: Hi Kat, We're bound from making statements that would disclose confidential information regarding a client matter. However, that doesn't sound like anything we would've done. While we have no control over court dockets, sometimes causing cases to take longer that anybody would like, we generally provide client updates every 30 to 45 days and have an always available CaseStatus app for around the clock updates. Reach out to us on the office number at 256-399-9470 so we can get to the bottom of your issues. -Kyle

name: Alan Richards
text:
Did a great job for me after a DUI....
I have never had the need for a criminal defense lawyer – until I did!  I hired Mr. Russell Crumbley based on two recommendations from persons who work in the legal business.  Now, I am the one recommending Russ and his team at Crumbley-Blackwell & Associates to anyone reading this.  Just hours after my arrest, I was able to make an appointment before my first visit to the court.  Having never been in this situation before, this was very important to me.  Russ was with me every step of the way.  In the end, my case was dismissed thanks to this fine law firm.
There were many court appearances, so I was able to observe his interactions with other defense lawyers, prosecutors, and two judges.  It was obvious to me that he is well liked and, more importantly, well respected in the legal community.  It takes more than just navigating the legal system (which Russ did with ease), it also takes relationships.
Again, I highly recommend Mr. Crumbley and will never forget what he did for me.

resp.text: Thank you, so much, Alan for those kind words. It was a privilege to represent you and I am really glad it worked out for you. It was quite stressful for you but it is behind you now. Best wishes for you moving forward. ~ Russell

name: Christopher Fitzgibbon
text:
Chris F.

I was arrested nearly 2 years after a bar fight for felony assault, had never been arrested before and both a family friend and the bail bondsman recommended Crumbley-Blackwell. I hired Mr. Crumbley as my lawyer and he did everything he could. They tried to get me to take a plea for a misdemeanor and 2 years probation and Mr. Crumbley easily could of just told me to take it, as he was already paid and could of dumped me off and move on, but he insisted we take it to trial because he thought wasn't right what was happening and i never should of been arrested or charged for defending myself when I was attacked. He believed we could win and so I went with his advice. In the end right before the trial he got all charges dismissed and even court fees waived and I just had to pay a small restitution fee. Hiring Mr. Crumbley was the best decision I could have made and am extremely thankful to him and his firm for everything. Hopefully I never have any use for him again but if I'm ever in a bad way again he'll definitely be my first call.

resp.text: Chris: I felt strongly about your case. I hated you had to go through what you did. It took guts on your part so kudos to you, sir. You stood strong. I just stood beside you. Be blessed! ~ Russell

name: Mary Windham
text: About the same as Hodge. My brother recommended Crumblee. I have made three attempts. Each one has been the bums rush. Strike three, you're out.

resp.text: Bums rush? Three attempts? You really don't provide me with much to go on here but if you have a legal matter with which we can help ... that is what we do! If you need to speak with me please TEXT ME at 256-503-1185 and I will personally call you from my cell phone and help you decide if you have a case with which we can help you. Whatever your frustration, that is not our purpose here. I really don't know what else I can say ~ Russell

text: Took my 200 fee and didn't even attempt to help. Pretty funny if all Lawyers charge a fee Mr Dutton from Lawrence county didn't charge me a dime not one red cent! So stop!!

resp.text: Our attorneys charge a consultation fee for cases involving family law and/or DHR. You were told in advance that your consultation would cost $200.00. You agreed and paid the fee. To maximize the value of that consultation, my staff gave you a list of items (in advance) to bring to the meeting for the attorney to evaluate for you. After meeting with you, our Sr Attorney advised you on how he could move forward on your behalf to accomplish your goals. He explained the fee structure and gave you the opportunity to retain us to move forward on your case. You chose not to hire us. That closed the matter. Please feel free to share Mr. Dutton's phone number here for those who, like yourself, would prefer a free consultation. I will not be offended by that at all. I wish you and Mr. Dutton nothing but the best. - Russell

name: JW Wryta
text: I am a male 37 year old honor discharged protected veteran who holds a Masters Degree and has never had any issues with the law prior to my DUI in 2017.  While my charges were from 2017, I was not arrested until 2019 because I was sent to the hospital on the date of the offense instead of jail and diagnosed with Sudden Traumatic Shock exasperated by alcohol.  Being arrested was completely out of the norm for me.  I did not know where to begin, what to expect, and was consistently imagining the worst possible outcomes and scenarios.  Based off my charges, my bail agent highly recommended that I contact Mr. Crumbly for counsel.  I had an initial meeting with Mr. Crumbly within a week from the first time I contacted him.  The initial meeting did not take longer then an hour and during that time Mr. Crumbly was able to explain all my available options to include representation options, payment options, court expectations, and expected timelines.  Perhaps the most beneficial thing Mr. Crumbly discussed in the initial meeting was the overall stress of the situation.  He told me that it was human nature to imagine the worst possible outcomes and to not worry about that as it was him and his teams job to make sure those outcomes don’t happen.  He was absolutely right and ,during the entire course of my case, I constantly imagined the worst possible scenarios; however, I always made myself think back to that initial conversation with Mr. Crumbly and remembered that is why he is there.  After that initial meeting, Mr. Crumbly and his team handled everything for 6 months up until my court date with the Judge.  Before I even had to go before the Judge, Mr. Crumbly had secured a deal with the DA for me to enter the Pre-Trial Intervention Program (PTIP) and have charges dropped following the completion of the program.  I was more than happy to enter PTIP as it took all uncertainty and stress off the table and I was able to hold everything going forward in my own hands.  As of May 2020, I have successfully completed the PTIP program and am currently working with Mr. Crumbly on having my charges expunged.  I am very pleased with the services I have received from Mr. Crumbly and his team and would highly recommend them.  While I am not going to put personal information on here for obvious reasons, Mr. Crumbly has my full permission to give my number to prospective clients who would like a recommendation.

resp.text: JW: It was a pleasure to work with/for you. And, YOU sir, did a great job yourself. ~ Russell

He took the time to get the recording of the 911 call and the body cam of the officer and reviewed it all. He had his last visit with me before court and he showed me what he was going to present to the court and what he was going to say and when I left I felt very confident that this was going to be the win we needed. So we went to court and sure enough he got everything dropped and cleared. I highly recommend Mr. Crumbley . Very amazing and welcoming! Thanks you Mr. Crumbley for working so diligently on my case!
